Imagine that you are a robot operating a smartphone to use the Calendar app. Like how humans operate the smartphone, you can tap, long tap, input text, scroll, and get attributes of the UI elements in the Calendar app. You need to write scripts to manipulate the UI elements (buttons, text fields, scrollers, element_lists, etc) in the app. 

**Your ultimate task is: change the view from monthly to yearly**

In the script, you can use the following APIs:
- <element_selector>.tap()
- <element_selector>.tap(<child_element)
- <element_selector>.set_text(<text>)
- <element_selector>.scroll(<direction>)
- <element_selector>.get_text()
- <element_selector>.get_attributes()
- back()

- $<element id>
- <element_list>[<idx>]

Imagine that you are a robot operating a smartphone to use the Calendar app. Like how humans operate the smartphone, you can tap, long tap, input text, scroll, and get attributes of the UI elements in the Calendar app. You need to write scripts to manipulate the UI elements (buttons, text fields, scrollers, element_lists, etc) in the app.

In the script, you can use the following APIs:
- <element_selector>.tap()
- <element_selector>.tap(<child_element)
- <element_selector>.set_text(<text>)
- <element_selector>.scroll(<direction>)
- <element_selector>.get_text()
- <element_selector>.get_attributes()
- back()

- $<element id>
- <element_list>[<idx>]

Dialer:
Imagine that you are a robot operating a smartphone to use the Dialer app. Like how humans operate the smartphone, you can tap, long tap, input text, scroll, and get attributes of the UI elements in the Dialer app. You need to write scripts to manipulate the UI elements (buttons, text fields, scrollers, element_lists, etc) in the app. 

**Your ultimate task is: create a new contact John Smith, moblie number 12345678900**

In the script, you can use the following APIs:
- <element_selector>.tap()
- <element_selector>.tap(<child_element)
- <element_selector>.set_text(<text>)
- <element_selector>.scroll(<direction>)
- <element_selector>.get_text()
- <element_selector>.get_attributes()
- back()

The <element_selector> primitive is used to select an element, possible ways of selection include:
- $<element id>
- <element_list>[<idx>]

The <element_list> primitive is used to select a list of elements, possible ways of selection include:
- <element_selector>:

Imagine that you are a robot operating a smartphone to use the Dialer app. Like how humans operate the smartphone, you can tap, long tap, input text, scroll, and get attributes of the UI elements in the Dialer app. You need to write scripts to manipulate the UI elements (buttons, text fields, scrollers, element_lists, etc) in the app.

- <element_selector>.tap()
- <element_selector>.tap(<child_element)
- <element_selector>.set_text(<text>)
- <element_selector>.scroll(<direction>)
- <element_selector>.get_text()
- <element_selector>.get_attributes()
- back()

- $<element id>
- <element_list>[<idx>]

Imagine that you are a robot operating a smartphone to use the Dialer app. Like how humans operate the smartphone, you can tap, long tap, input text, scroll, and get attributes of the UI elements in the Dialer app. You need to write scripts to manipulate the UI elements (buttons, text fields, scrollers, element_lists, etc) in the app.

- <element_selector>.tap()
- <element_selector>.tap(<child_element)
- <element_selector>.set_text(<text>)
- <element_selector>.scroll(<direction>)

- <element_selector>.get_attributes()

- $<element id>
- <element_list>[<idx>]

- <element_selector>:

Imagine that you are a robot operating a smartphone to use the Dialer app. Like how humans operate the smartphone, you can tap, long tap, input text, scroll, and get attributes of the UI elements in the Dialer app. You need to write scripts to manipulate the UI elements (buttons, text fields, scrollers, element_lists, etc) in the app.

- <element_selector>.tap()
- <element_selector>.tap(<child_element)
- <element_selector>.set_text(<text>)
- <element_selector>.scroll(<direction>)
- <element_selector>.get_text()
- <element_selector>.get_attributes()

- $<element id>
- <element_list>[<idx>]

- <element_selector>:

- <element_selector>.tap(<child_element)

- $<element id>
- <element_list>[<idx>]

Music:
Imagine that you are a robot operating a smartphone to use the Music app. Like how humans operate the smartphone, you can tap, long tap, input text, scroll, and get attributes of the UI elements in the Music app. You need to write scripts to manipulate the UI elements (buttons, text fields, scrollers, element_lists, etc) in the app. 

**Your ultimate task is: change the theme of the Music player app to light and save it**

In the script, you can use the following APIs:
- <element_selector>.tap()
- <element_selector>.tap(<child_element)
- <element_selector>.set_text(<text>)
- <element_selector>.scroll(<direction>)
- <element_selector>.get_text()
- <element_selector>.get_attributes()
- back()

The <element_selector> primitive is used to select an element, possible ways of selection include:
- $<element id>
- <element_list>[<idx>]

The <element_list> primitive is used to select a list of elements, possible ways of selection include:
- <element_selector>:
- <element_list>.match(<text or attribute dict>)
